website_summaries.verdict: The best audio mixer money can buy. Ample inputs, easy-to-use USB functions, hearty construction, and a terrific sound.
pros: Offers more inputs (12) and recording options than any other contender on our shortlist
cons: A slight humming noise has been noted during USB recording
This noise can easily be eliminated by adjusting USB control

customer_reviews.title: 😖After 1 year and a half it started failing😖
customer_reviews.text: We use it in our studio almost every day and from the beginning, like a month after we got it, it was causing us problems😠, however we left it pass. The gain volumes are failing, since it is always set to one position, most likely they just burned out, I have to keep moving it few times until I find a new position until the mic comes back🎙🎙 👎🏻We spent money changing cables, I was going to change my AKG C214 MICS, then ☘ luckily realized that the problem was this mixer 🤦‍♂🤦‍♀🤦‍♂🤦‍♀ 👎🏻We recommend it if you plan to use it very lightly for less than a year
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Great board great price. I use this board in the studio and in the field. Better than most and its durable. After 6 months of use the board crapped out. Channels are fuzzy. No help from Mackie. The tech told me these boards have a DNR policy. Do not replace. This is my second for stop. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer, Quickly Grew Out of It
customer_reviews.text: So, this is a great mixer, but if you think that you might need a something a little bigger, extra inputs or outputs, go with the larger unit. It didn't take long for me to realize that the 4-Channel mixer wouldn't work for me in the long run. That is no fault of the mixer at all, I just wish I had realized that before hand. Also, make sure you download the manual from the Mackie web site so that you can use the mixer to its fullest potential - what comes in the packaging is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mixer. Only thing I find lacking is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Mixer. Only thing I find lacking is the poor information for new users or users with limited knowledge. For instance on how to connect what to what if you want to use it on a PC. But the Mixer has worked great for me and is good quality def. worth the money. 5/5 if they upgrade info for noobs
customer_reviews.author: Francis W.

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has been in my life for a little over a year. The first one i got crapped out on me in about a month or two. Called customer service and they were very helpful. I just had to prove that I bought it with my Amazon receipt and return the old one, then they sent me the new one. The new one worked up until about a month ago. This mixer does not have a long shelf life, but it's affordable. I think I would rather spend more for something that will last as long as my little Behringer EuroRacks which have been working since College! Great customer service Not so great product shelf life
customer_reviews.author: Row Jones

customer_reviews.title: bad condition.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in and it got hot and started to arch. Requested a refund and never received it!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Much more than expected. If you, as I have many auxiliary stereo feeds, this is the mixer board for you. This unit even allows me to take individual input feeds and throw them through other devices to bring about harmony voices etc. Needless to say, I am very happy with my purchase. It reminds me of the first unit I built from scratch. It too had 12 channels and stereo reverb. My delay had a dedicated tape deck for delay, complete with sliding playback head. This saved me a minimum of three months of time, and lots of labor.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES ROBERT RENAULT

customer_reviews.title: Great for Podcasting
customer_reviews.text: I use this Mackie mixer in my classroom for our podcast. I really like that we can have four microphones hooked up at once and I can control the sound of each one independently. There is that one kid who is always louder and the other one who is a heavy breather. This allows me to modify without frustration and without loosing hours of recording time. I find it to be a great product and figure it will last us for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: K T

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor. Buy a different product.
customer_reviews.text: First, I work in I.T. and Audio / Visual. This product made a constant popping sound when we plugged in two high quality speakers using the male XLR slots. In addition, we plugged in high quality microphones into 12 of the the female XLR slots and there was an occasional brief wave of high-pitch feedback that all forms of troubleshooting would not eliminate. Then we used our existing 6 channel mixer instead of this product, and none of the aforementioned happened. Spend the extra money and buy a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Zacholio

customer_reviews.title: I like it BUT .....
customer_reviews.text: The thing does what I want it to. But I've only had it 2 months with very little use and already the R side LED Main Meter lights have gone out and the L side Main XLR out isn't working. I'm am using the 1/4" outs now so I know a channel isn't blown just a pain in the butt to have to tear it down to fix this. If you use something like this you should know a little about them and be able to do small repairs...I do...Not much to an analog mixer...Just Jacks and pot's arranged to get the source where it needs to go. Works fine for me. not with the trouble to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Zink

customer_reviews.title: Simply and amazing pro mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Undoubtedly, this is another awesome mixer from Mackie. Having used the older models, I immediately noticed how quiet and clear the vocals are through this new mixer. I have used it several times for live performances and it has delivered magnificently. I will recommend it for any type of pro use where microphone and/or musical instrument amplification is required. Make sure to have a reputable amplifier and speakers (or Powered Speakers) to complete the overall sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I use this to combine output from my PC (Band in a Box) and my guitar to practice rather than my amp. Output to headphones. The built in effects are great. This setup is incredible for practice. I haven't even touched its capabilities. However just note that it isn't a true 4 input mixer since channels 3/4 are combined into a single stage
customer_reviews.author: Adam Orden

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet upgrade for me! Tend to bypass the eq, and use my speakers built in adjustments/daw/instruments tone adjustments. Have been using usb and analog outs, as well as some super creative patching and have not noticed an audio quality issue that couldn’t be fixed by adjusting something in my pa (levels levels levels). (Video is usb audio playback)
customer_reviews.author: Coolradiation

customer_reviews.title: USB makes connections super simple when changing around sound setup on pc
customer_reviews.text: USB makes connections super simple when changing around sound setup on pc, multiple channels gives room to grow without repurchasing a bigger mixer, channel sliders are a welcome change from knobs, and is straightforward to use, assuming you have used one before.
customer_reviews.author: tec

customer_reviews.title: This mixer can run directly from a 12 volt battery.
customer_reviews.text: This mixer can run straight off of a 12-volt SLA battery. You will not find this information in the instruction manual but it does work quite well. The mixer is okay but I'm not getting any response from the main EQ to the main outs. The effects leave something to be desired. The 3 preset delay speeds are too fast are pretty much useless and there is no way to custom set the speed or choose a number of repeats. Still it is worth the small price tag. Yay go portable!
customer_reviews.author: Russ in FL

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer failed
customer_reviews.text: Had to return my item, i didn’t get a chance to use this since as soon as I plugged it in all of the mute light failed to light up. I could have ignored this is maybe it would had been one light failing to light up but all of the mute buttons, NO this is no acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for all my studio/podcast needs. Sound output is clean and loud. Make sure you get the 1/4 headphone adapters if you use an aux. Also, make sure you have the phantom power on if you have a condenser mic. Worth the money 100%
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: Great board. Clean, clean sound. Bumped one star for no parameter tweaking on the onboard effects. Too many details to list but I’m really happy with what you get for the price. Easy to understand and use.
customer_reviews.author: INFORMATION

customer_reviews.title: Sad these are disappearing due to the V3's being released.
customer_reviews.text: These are great mixers. I bought a PROFX16V2 for church when their prices started dropping with the introduction of Mackie's V3's, and weeks later snagged the PROFX12V2 for home on the same price knee. If you're hesitating purchasing a PROFXnnV2, get them while they're still available. Reviews on the V3 have been underwhelming and you'll be paying full price.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Returned Because of Issues
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with a couple of the channels not working correctly. Also the equalizer doesn't work on the USB in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Issues? You Can't Get In Contact With Anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Started having issues with the mixer producing major static sounds over USB about 15 minutes after powering it on. Then it was not recognizing turning the dials. If you unplug and replug the USB connection, the static goes away. Tried calling since October. Their support line constantly rang busy. Tried sending an online support ticket, their system would not allow sending the support request. Tried via social media, no response. Equipment with an issue, then can't get a warranty? Not worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Carter

customer_reviews.title: Quality you can feel when using.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with my purchase, after various YouTube videos I got all the functions down packed. Very lows noise, except the USB connection. There is a noticeable build up when you touch this cable. I still love the craftmenship of the mixer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DJ S1

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The descripstion doesn’t say that it will not record each line on its own track if you’re recording music or something like a podcast. It’s great for live music or if you don’t mind recording everything together. The pre-amps are great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I went thru 3 other mixers and this is a keeper. Easy to use, good quality. Works perfect for my NS7 and mic. I like the EQ the best and the fact that I have so many options for controlling the volume. I would recommend buying and for the price, you cant beat it
customer_reviews.author: Martalian90

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Worked Perfectly for almost 2 years. Now there's some strange popping and crackling coming though the mic channels. not just 1. all of them. And yes I've changed the cables. The popping itself is actually picked up on the mixer's readout without anything plugged into it at all except power. Not sure what's happened to it as it sits in the same spot on my desk as it always has. Guess they aren't made to stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board because I wanted something for my various audio inputs when streaming, as well as a minor amount of general recording. This thing holds up like every mackie I've used in the past has, and does everything I need it to. I have no issues with the USB connection adding unwanted noise. I really have no issues with this board, and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tamm

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Mackie 1202, this is an extra for upstairs to run instrument lines through my computer and speakers. Drum machine, synth, guitar line and mic. Works good, effects are pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Talmadge

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Just did my first podcast and the clarity was amazing! Very much looking forward to many years of working with this piece of equipment and producing great things! I bought a Mackie PROFX8V2 8-Channel Compact Mixer with USB and Effects for my new podcast because I have had prior experience with Mackie mixers and good results. I thought I had a bad board but what I had was a brain fart. My mistake or oversight made me think I had a bad board. Nothing could be further from the truth. Mackie scores big time again!
customer_reviews.author: Frank C Auenson

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer I have my computer plugged into it so I can play my music right from my PC. The mixer feeds into a sonic maximizer for the subs which feeds to 2 europower 2500 watt amps and then into the subs and the mains are feed by a europower 4000 watt amp. The cool thing with this mixer is that anyone can come over and jam with the amount of inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Turcotte

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mixer you could get.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer to replace another one (different brand) because the mic was making a constant hum. After lots of trouble shooting I was pretty sure that it was the mixer itself so I bought this one to replace the old one (I had it for over 5 years). The difference was astounding. I'm now able to get much louder sound both from my pc and the mic and it's cristal clear. I am a teacher and use the mixer to have both mic, pc, and phone audio delivered to powered speakers. It's a very simple set up and the mixer does the job wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: N. Olivares Reitze

customer_reviews.title: the board is great.
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed that this board seems to have some sort of effects on all the time - even if there are none selected. I cannot figure out what it is, but other than that, the board is great.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The USB port is extremely loose and will probably fail or cause intermittent contact soon, requiring warranty repair.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Use this as an input board to record Karaoke covers on my PC. Outstanding sound/effects.
customer_reviews.author: monkerz

customer_reviews.title: Revised review
customer_reviews.text: There was a negative review but it was not by me (I'm not sure by whom--perhaps the Amazon person I spoke with on the phone). There was some hang up with the shipping but it was not the fault of the seller. The product did arrive shortly after the shipping mix up was corrected. This is a an excellent studio mixer for the price. I'm absolutely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: senjata

customer_reviews.title: Quality, durability, functionality - great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I own two Mackie's. One at the home studio for podcast recording, and this one in our indoor cycling arena. In short, if you're looking for a quality product that delivers without a hiccup, I wouldn't look much further. The price to value ratio is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great performing mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great performing mixer. Not my favorite mixer for home mixing, but great for performance. The box makes it easy to use as a case, but be warned to push the left and right most volume sliders to the up position before boxing up so you don't damage it with the foam insert.
customer_reviews.author: NATman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Much nicer than anticipated. Color in real way over rides the colors in pictures. Been dialing onobs for a long time. Great buy, much better product. Makie at their top of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Tomy

customer_reviews.title: If this is used...!?!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived as “Used” today. I have used gear, I have played through used gear, but I have never seen something so pristine as this as “used” gear. Every aspect of it works as it should and it is easy to use and sounds amazing. I literally hooked it up to my TDK Bluetooth speaker and it sounds fantastic. Can’t wait to connect it to a PA.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D

customer_reviews.title: Mixer is great, just wish they had included the PFL portion ...
customer_reviews.text: Mixer is great, just wish they had included the PFL portion on these otherwise well featured mixers. *Note: the main fader has no effect on the USB out.
customer_reviews.author: FPD Business

customer_reviews.title: Mackie is not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Effects did not work right out of the box. Seller was excellent! No issues returning. If they carried a better brand I would definitely buy from them...
customer_reviews.author: Chucky P.

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality mixer and it lived up to the Mackie reputation as the best mid-priced mixer product line in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Graves

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: It does all the basic functions of a mixer very well. Have not explored many of the additional features yet I would buy it again if needed, but there will probably new models by then.
customer_reviews.author: Why Do I Need a Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good fxs, great UI
customer_reviews.text: Warehouse release item? This thing was brand new with just a rubber feet missing at the front bottom corner! Good fxs, great UI, just what the doctor ordered for karaoke! Won’t be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: IPickAmazon!

customer_reviews.title: it was 100 times better, especially with the eq effects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer for home Karaoke to be used with a UHF wireless mic set and a rockville speaker. The speaker with the mics and the tv plugged in sounded muffled and so so, but once I routed everything through the Mackie, it was 100 times better, especially with the eq effects. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Perfect size for desk top/ small project work. My only complaint is it didn't come with a cover, I had to hunt the internet for one.
customer_reviews.author: Sambonz

customer_reviews.title: The only thing it is good for is the phantom power
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is very very basic ... The only thing it is good for is the phantom power ... which you can buy on its own for alot less. Nothing really works on this thing and it seems as though all the knobs and buttons are for show. I would suggest you look at something else. All the pot knobs are dirty with static ... this mixer, simply is a cheap, non effective piece of equipment. This is all my opinion ... take it as you will. I will probably send mine back.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this 8 channels mixer for karaoke/D
customer_reviews.text: At first there was a miss understanding when I was testing it out. But everything turned out smooth as shown on the box. My Mackie mixer sounds spectacular. I would recommend this 8 channels mixer for karaoke/D.J's.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Perez

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like It Would Cost More
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality seems like it would cost more. Replaced my Yamaha MG10 that one side stopped working. Love the built in eqs and the sound is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Dandman

customer_reviews.title: The Mute Buttons don't light up....
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small stage that rotates 3 or 4 piece bands every night of the week, they just have a couple of mic's plugged in... I set this up to replace a very similar one we have. Next thing you know I am getting calls all the time about channels not working... anyway. The mute lights don't light up. Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Private JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, But Get Professional Assistance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a show at an elementary school. The first 2 nights of the show, we struggled with feedback and not hearing the children. On the 3rd show, we hired a professional DJ and the system worked beautifully. This is not a system for the beginner.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed to mic my drums. The built in effects, and other features are great. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Donald McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment for our church!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a very old 16 with this one. Very quiet. Perfect sound. All the versatility we needed for multiple mics, instrument, and line level device inputs with multiple outs for mains, monitors, and auxiliary amplifiers as well as mixdown to video camera for live video broadcast and recording.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Borkowski

customer_reviews.title: Zero latency recording.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mixer as a signal chain for my microphone into my pc audio interface. Using the mixer this way eliminates latency and i don't uave to lower my buffer size.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little USB audio mixer
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding audio mixer; handles microphones, instruments, computer inputs easily, and outputs to speakers, Tascam Dr60 mrkII, video camera are flawless. Plus it is easy to carry in a Gator bag
customer_reviews.author: Mal4

customer_reviews.title: Is ok
customer_reviews.text: Noticed some static when I enable the voice effects. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for a beginning home studio or broadcast/podcast. Its very simple to use. Works well with windows. Built quality is awesome. The built in effects are basic effects but useful. Easy to hear your recording from computer by turning a volume knob. Just wish it had a compressor but other than that i do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: Started using this mixer at my karaoke shows. Music sounded great. East to use and effects were great. Did my homework about different mixers and for the quality the price on this mixer was super.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Cuneo

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband runs his own radio station and he says this works just as good as the bigger ones.
customer_reviews.author: tboites

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Audio Controls
customer_reviews.text: Packed with great features. Easy to use. Great value for money. Some noise in lines for guitar and keyboards. Lowering the volume when these instruments not in use works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal X

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to my old Mackie from the 90's
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to my old Mackie from the 90's; quiet and great USB interface and pre-amps. Very quiet and easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: S.D.Young

customer_reviews.title: Built in Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for our needs. The on board mic preamps are killer. Great value and bang for the buck. I especially like that it has universal power supply built in. Cool!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tom Griner

customer_reviews.title: Just fine
customer_reviews.text: We've been gigging with this for around two years. It's got all we need and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Bird

customer_reviews.title: A versatile and outstanding mixer
customer_reviews.text: I use this with power speakers from Alto and the combination has changed my life as goes small to medium gig sound systems. Read the instructions well, the versatility of this unit is incomparable. This model just the right size for my needs
customer_reviews.author: brijthisgap

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very clean audio. but I sold it for Mackie FX16 because of more groups.
customer_reviews.author: Roland G. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: High quality, use with bose l1 system and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Juan R. Carazo

customer_reviews.title: Mackie never disappoints!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I've always been a mackie fan. Perfect size, easy to carry and is a workhorse. I recommend this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Eftim Mihov

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pair with the Shure SM7B
customer_reviews.text: Works absolutely perfect with the Shure SM7B mic. Beautiful bassy vocals just as I expected. The built in preamp is perfect and no other audio amplifiers are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Never got it to work with my computer might have gotten a bad unit
customer_reviews.author: DJ2BIG

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A decent mixer for the price. Would have given 5 stars, but some of the gain pots are noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent board for a mid size use
customer_reviews.text: excellent board for a mid size use. We were able to control a wireless system and two corded mics plus computer input into this board. It worked like a charm. Easy to set up and use. Not very heavy which is good for transport purposes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I use it to practice & small performances
customer_reviews.author: JMARTIN

customer_reviews.title: It's good if you avoid USB connection!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. For the most part. It has a static/hum sound when connected to USB. I have tried everything, even chatting with someone from the manufacturer. He claims that it's just something I "can't do anything about". So, I use it with a sound recorder interface I have, connected via XLR cables. I then transfer to my computer when I'm done. It works, but I definitely should not have to inconvenience myself that much because one of the selling points of this board doesn't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: Mackie rarely disappoints , and this little unit is no exception. the 16 presets make it a slam dunk for the beginning user
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this to replace the old one that was damaged accidentally and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jruss

customer_reviews.title: Liking the Mackie!
customer_reviews.text: I received a new product. I thought it might have been a used in new condition but it wasn't. Can't wait to see how this performs. So far I'm likin it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Little tough to get use to, but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hamar

customer_reviews.title: Right meter light
customer_reviews.text: I like the pro but need to exchange Another one because main meters right light does not working and the rude solo light keep blinking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Professionally described, processed and delivered. Read the Reviews online for ease of use and performance.
customer_reviews.author: HendersonHeart_1

customer_reviews.title: A great Value.
customer_reviews.text: The Mackie Profx8v2 it a perfect-light weight mixer which is packed with features. As a musician I use it for solo work and for remote control for 3 horn players in a 70's group. A great Value.
customer_reviews.author: wallyd

customer_reviews.title: Mackie web site sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Mackie products, but over the years, quality has gone down, support sucks and website even worse.... Thank you JBL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sukie Uppal

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer that does a little bit of everything
customer_reviews.text: Great little mixer that does a little bit of everything. My only regret is not purchasing the 12 or 16 channel model right away. I'm out of inputs!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Guzman

customer_reviews.title: My old mackie was great! This isn't even close
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get a warm sound ... sounds tinny. I have worked with it every which way and cannot acheive a clear, warm vocal. The fx presets are awful! My old mackie was great! This isn't even close. Did I get a bad unit? I don't know! Really sensitive. Get bass distortion and feedback really easily. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for musicians and DJ on the go. Sturdy build and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this because I needed to provide sound support for a wedding ceremony. It worked perfectly and sounded great. I plugged in the wireless mic for the officiant, a guitar, 2 wired mic for violins. It also has phantom power on it that helped the mics work as well. I am going to be using this for all my big events and for weddings. I have a pioneer ddj-sx and it has horrible feedback with the mic input. I will no longer be plugging my wireless mic into my controller but directly into a Mackie Mixer input instead. I also recommend getting the New Mackie DFX6/ProFX8 Soft Mixer Travel Bag/Case With Shoulder Strap to help protect your investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sincere

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE. EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: GOOD PRICE. EASY TO USE. This mixer is very good. I recommend for everyone who will looking mixer for karaoke.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: Mackie ProFx12v2 is one of the Best mid-range mixer mixer, performance wise, thumbs up! 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: I happy with the performance this product, I recommend you to buy this, one of the best mixer I have.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer to primarily to take on the road with my DJ Equipment, and its been awesome! It has great built in effects, and the overall build and sound quality is great! I've had Mackie mixers in the past, and haven't always been in love with them, but this one does the job great! For a couple Mic's, a Guitar and an Aux input, this has been great as well!
customer_reviews.author: DarthMcJoker

product_meta.title: Mackie, B Box, 12-channel (PROFX12V2)
product_meta.description: Size:12-channel| Configuration:MixerThe Mackie ProFX12v2 12-channel USB mixer means you can stop sacrificing sound quality for portability at your smaller band and solo acoustic gigs. You get six of Mackie's Vita preamps for your mic, guitar, keyboard, or anything else you need for your show. After you've plugged in, tap into the powerful ReadyFX effects engine to add excitement to your mix. Show your audience you care by giving them the best sound you can with the Mackie ProFX12v2 USB mixer. Like the name says, the ProFX12v2 is a professional mixer, with convenient features and sound that rival some larger format mixers. Mackie designed the Vita preamps with live sound in mind to provide the quality of sound that is lacking in some compact mixers. Each channel features its own individual 3-band EQ and 100Hz low-cut filter for shaping the sound of your inputs. The ReadyFX digital effects engine gives you access to 16 different effects including reverbs and delays - Mackie even added chorus effects for your guitar. A 7-band graphic EQ can be assigned either to your main outputs so you can fine tune the PA, or to the aux output to easily get rid of feedback in your monitors. If you perform with backing tracks, there are inputs (including USB) for your laptop or MP3 player, a headphone output with individual level control, and even phantom power for your condenser mics. With the added convenience of a hi-Z input for direct instrument input, you have no reason NOT to own a ProFX12v2. The ProFX12v2 is exactly what you need for mixing when the gig calls for minimal inputs, but that's not where its usefulness ends. Since you'll be mixing from the stage, keep the ProFX12v2 right next to you, and you can use the headphone output with a set of in-ear monitors for your performance and just leave your floor monitors at home. Drummers can use it for monitoring, too - take the aux mix from the front of house board that would have gone to your wedges and plug it in to a channel on the ProFX12v2.
feature_bullets: Be sure that the volume of the input is the same as it would be during normal use, or you may have to readjust the gain in the middle of a set
6 low-noise Mackie Vita mic preamps add life to any input. ReadyFX effects engine with 16 effects including reverbs, delays, and choruses
7-band graphic EQ for tuning mains or monitors. You can listen with headphones if you carefully turn up the channel fader and headphones level a little
Aux output for monitor mixes, venue 70-volt systems, and more
3 band EQ 80 Hz, 2.5 kHz and 12 KHz on all channelsand 100 Hz low-cut filter on all channels
